title: James Hoffmann's French Press Method
preparation_steps: Heat water to 95°C (just off boil)
Grind 30 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency
Pre-warm your French Press with hot water
Empty and dry the French Press completely
Add 30g ground coffee to the French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 500g hot water evenly over grounds
Stir gently with a spoon to ensure all grounds are saturated
Place lid on top (do not press plunger yet)
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Place lid • Do not press yet

brewing_steps.instruction: Wait 5 minutes for extraction (do not disturb)
Press plunger down slowly and steadily, then pour immediately

notes: James Hoffmann's refined French Press method produces a clean, full-bodied cup with minimal sediment. The key is using medium-coarse grind, precise timing, and avoiding over-extraction by pressing slowly and pouring immediately.

title: Tim Wendelboe French Press Technique
preparation_steps: Heat water to 96°C (just off boil)
Grind 28 grams of coffee to medium-fine consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Empty and dry completely
Add 28g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 450g hot water in circular motion
Stir gently 3 times back-to-front to create even extraction
Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 4 minutes for optimal extraction
Press plunger down slowly, pour within 30 seconds

notes: Tim Wendelboe's French Press method emphasizes precision and control. Using medium-fine grind and shorter extraction time produces a brighter, more nuanced cup while maintaining the characteristic body of French Press coffee.

title: Stumptown Coffee Roasters French Press
preparation_steps: Heat water to 94°C (just off boil)
Grind 32 grams of coffee to coarse consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Empty and dry completely
Add 32g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 512g hot water evenly over grounds
Stir gently with wooden spoon to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 6 minutes for full extraction
Press plunger down slowly, pour immediately

notes: Stumptown's French Press method uses a longer extraction time and coarse grind to create a rich, full-bodied cup with deep flavors. The wooden spoon prevents scratching and the extended steep time ensures complete extraction.

title: Blue Bottle Coffee French Press
preparation_steps: Heat water to 93°C (just off boil)
Grind 30 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Empty and dry completely
Add 30g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 480g hot water in slow spiral
Stir gently 4 times to ensure even saturation
Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 4.5 minutes for optimal extraction
Press plunger down slowly, pour within 15 seconds

notes: Blue Bottle's French Press method focuses on precision and consistency. The slow spiral pour and gentle stirring ensure even extraction, while the medium-coarse grind provides the perfect balance of body and clarity.

title: Intelligentsia Coffee French Press
preparation_steps: Heat water to 95°C (just off boil)
Grind 29 grams of coffee to medium consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Empty and dry completely
Add 29g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 464g hot water evenly over grounds
Stir gently with bamboo spoon to saturate grounds
Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 3.75 minutes for extraction
Press plunger down slowly, pour immediately

notes: Intelligentsia's French Press method uses medium grind and shorter extraction time to create a bright, clean cup while maintaining the characteristic body. The bamboo spoon prevents scratching and adds a touch of elegance.

Empty and dry completely
Add 31g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 496g hot water in circular motion
Stir gently with wooden spoon to saturate all grounds
Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 5.4 minutes for full extraction
Press plunger down slowly, pour within 20 seconds

notes: Counter Culture's French Press method emphasizes sustainability and quality. The wooden spoon prevents scratching, while the precise timing and medium-coarse grind create a balanced cup with excellent body and clarity.

Stir gently with bamboo spoon to create even extraction
brewing_steps.short_instruction: Stir with bamboo spoon • Even extraction

brewing_steps.instruction: Place lid on top, do not press plunger
Wait 4.25 minutes for optimal extraction
